page.title: 03CONSERVATION
page.content: This mainly farmland and wooded area was designated to be the largest New Town in the North West. However, after much pressure from the local community it was decided that industry would be limited to the two industrial sites of Red Scar and Rough Hey and a different area south of the Ribble was chosen to be the new town. The region is left for those who like to fish, ramble and birdwatch. The local trees are mainly oak, beech,lime horsechestnut, sycamore and elm. Wild flowers include the greater stitchwort rootstock, red clover, ox-eye dog rose and great willow herb. Birds to be spotted in the area include kestrels, herons, dippers, great black backed gulls and sparrow hawks.
